column1: Dáin was the son of King [[Náin II]], and he had a younger brother [[Borin]].  He had three children, [[Thrór]], [[Frór]], and [[Grór]].

Dáin flourished during the period when the [[House of Durin]] was seated in the [[Grey Mountains]]. He succeeded his father when the [[Dragons]] of the north had declared [[War of the Dwarves and Dragons
column2: war against]] the [[Dwarves of the Grey Mountains]]. Dáin ruled his people, who were troubled by increasing attacks from his [[Dáin's halls
column3: halls]] until his rule came to a premature end when both he and his second son, Frór, were killed by a [[Cold-drakes

column1: After his death, his sons Thrór and Grór led most of the [[Dwarves]] of Durin's folk south. Thrór led [[Dwarves of Erebor
column2: one group]] back to [[Lonely Mountain]], while Grór founded [[Dwarves of the Iron Hills
column3: his own realm]] in the [[Iron Hills]].<ref name="Durin"/>
